results.definition: pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
examples: in the old days, people were drawn and quartered for certain crimes

results.definition: the rear part of a ship
a district of a city having some distinguishing character
a fourth part of a year; three months
examples: unemployment fell during the last quarter
he dropped a word in the right quarter

results.definition: a quarter of a hundredweight (25 pounds)
a quarter of a hundredweight (28 pounds)
inRegion: united kingdom of great britain and northern ireland

results.definition: a United States or Canadian coin worth one fourth of a dollar
examples: he fed four quarters into the slot machine

results.definition: a unit of time equal to 15 minutes or a quarter of an hour
clemency or mercy shown to a defeated opponent
examples: he surrendered but asked for quarter

results.definition: divide by four; divide into quarters
(football, professional basketball) one of four divisions into which some games are divided
examples: both teams scored in the first quarter

results.definition: one of four periods into which the school year is divided
examples: the fall quarter ends at Christmas

results.definition: one of the four major division of the compass
examples: the wind is coming from that quarter

results.definition: piece of leather that comprises the part of a shoe or boot covering the heel and joining the vamp
